p: In 2015 and 2016, of the cases exhibiting neurological syndromes associated with ZIKV (Guillain–Barré syndrome, ascending polyneuropathies, or other similar neurological conditions), 270 cases with a history of febrile illness compatible with ZIKV infection were reported. In 2017, only 77 cases were reported, which were more frequent in the group of 10 to 19 years ( Table 1). Of these 77 cases, 72 (93.5%; 95% CI: 93.0%–94.2%) were hospitalized, and 3 died. Additionally, 45 of the cases (58.4%; 95% CI: 47.2%–69.0%) occurred in men.
